frame.name: Biological_area
frame.definition:
<def-root> This frame contains words that denote large ecological areas as well as smaller locations characterized by the type of life present--in other words, geography locations as defined by biota.
<ex>I've spent a long time in the <fex name="Descriptor">rugged</fex> <fex name="Locale"><t>prairies</t></fex> <fex name="Container_possessor">of northern Llorwyn</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Constituent_parts
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Constituent_parts</fen> make up a <fen>Locale</fen>. <ex>This is the oldest <fex name="Cnst">oak</fex> <t>forest</t> in California.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Container_possessor
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Container_possessor</fen> is the location of which the <fen>Locale</fen> is a part.
<ex>Jon explored the <t>forests</t> <fex name="ContP">of California</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Formational_cause
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Formational_cause</fen> brings about the features of the <fen>Locale</fen>. <ex>Jon explored the <fex name="FormC">sun-scorched</fex> <t>savanna</t>.</ex> This FE is also used for words that indicate no salient formation. <ex>Jon explored the <fex name="FormC">virgin</fex> <t>woodland</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Locale
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a stable bounded area, and is typically the designation of the nouns of Locale-derived frames. <ex>There used to be a <fex name="Locale"><t>forest</t></fex> in that valley.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Name</fen>s of <fen>Locale</fen>s. <ex>Jon explored the <t>forests</t> <fex name="Name">of California</fex>.</ex> <ex>Jon hiked around <fex name="Name">Muir</fex> <t>Woods</t>. </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Relative_location
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Relative_location</fen> identifies a place in respect to which a <fen>Locale</fen> is located.
<ex>All the <t>swamps</t> <fex name="RelLoc">outside of Georgia</fex> are dry.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description, characteristic, or property of the <fen>Locale</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs.
<ex>Apparently they found him at the bottom of a <fex name="des">really deep</fex> <t>bog</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: woestijn.n
lexUnit.definition: dat dor en droog en daardoor vrijwel onbewoonbaar is

lexUnit.name: moeras.n
lexUnit.definition: waarin je wegzakt als je er loopt

lexUnit.name: tra.n
lexUnit.definition: in een bos die open gehouden is en dient als weg en als afscheiding bij brand

lexUnit.name: toendra.n
lexUnit.definition: in de poolstreken op het Noordelijk halfrond, waarvan alleen de bovenste paar centimeter van de bodem niet permanent bevroren is

lexUnit.name: savanne.n
lexUnit.definition: in tropische en subtropische gebieden, met hier en daar wat bomen
